text:
Gem is a city in Thomas County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 88 people lived there.
History.
Gem was a shipping point on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad. The town was named from the Gem Ranch.
The first post office in Gem was created in 1885. It was closed in March 2014.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 88 people, 36 households, and 26 families living in the city.

annotations.surface_form: Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad
